Glossary of Terms:
* Event: Central to system communication. Events are generated by sensors and by services. Events communicate data through the ?????? system
* Sensor: Event generator, can only generate event_queue does not recieve or read the event queue. May be registered to services
* Service: A service listens for event_queue on the event queue and uses the data to make inferences about the world. A service can generate new event_queue when it wants to communicate information to the outside world.
* Actuator: Special case of a service where sending it an event can cause it to take an action on the real world. Usually only sends confirmation/completion event_queue.
* Event Handler: Subscribes to the event queue. Can conditionally fire based on if the new event in the queue meets the requirements/parameters for the event. 
* Event Provider: Abstract concept for a system to send event_queue to the event queue.
* Request Service: Service that handles request fufillment and confirmation. As well as ensuring that requests are completed even if an actuator goes down.
